hr.fer.zemris.java.tecaj.hw3

Class CString

  • java.lang.Object
    • hr.fer.zemris.java.tecaj.hw3.CString

  • public final class CString
extends java.lang.Object
    Class represents unmodifiable strings on which substring methods (and similar) are executed in O(1) complexity. Created by ilijan on 3/31/15.

    • Constructor Summary

      • CString

        public CString(char[] data,
               int offset,
               int length)
        Constructor that initializes new CString from given char array.
        Parameters:
        data - char array to initialize CString from.
        offset - beginning index in char array from which the string should be initialized.
        length - length of string to be initialized.

      • CString

        public CString(java.lang.String string)
        Constructor which initializes CString using supplied String.
        Parameters:
        string - string to initialize CString from.

      • CString

        public CString(CString original)
        Constructor which initializes CString using supplied CString. If original internal character array is larger than needed, new instance allocates its own character array of minimal required size and copies data; otherwise it reuses original character array.
        Parameters:
        original - original CString to initialize CString from.

      • substring

        public CString substring(int startIndex,
                         int endIndex)
        Returns new CString which represents a part of original string. Position endIndex does not belong to the substring and following constraints should be respected: startIndex>=0, endIndex >= startIndex.
        Parameters:
        startIndex - starting index from which substring will be taken.
        endIndex - ending index (not contained in substring) until which substring will be taken.
        Returns:
        new CString which represents a part of original string.
        Throws:
        CStringIndexOutOfBoundsException - if starting index is negative, or ending index larger than length.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if ending index is smaller than starting index.

      • left

        public CString left(int n)
        Returns new CString which represents leftmost n characters of the instance.
        Parameters:
        n - number of characters to take from the instance in a substring.
        Returns:
        new CString which represents left part of the instance.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if number of characters is negative or larger than length.

      • right

        public CString right(int n)
        Returns new CString which represents rightmost n characters of the instance.
        Parameters:
        n - number of characters to take from the instance in a substring.
        Returns:
        new CString which represents right part of the instance.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if number of characters is negative or larger than length.

      • add

        public CString add(CString string)

        Parameters:

      • replaceAll

        public CString replaceAll(char oldChar,
                          char newChar)
        Creates a new CString in which each occurrence of old character is replaced with new character.
        Parameters:
        oldChar - character to be replaced.
        newChar - replacing character.
        Returns:
        new CString in which each occurrence of old character is replaced with new character.
